result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin C Laboy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for work and childcare.
Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on JULY 25TH, 2022.

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine in the amount of $300.00 inclusive of ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on JULY 25TH.
No possession or use of firearms.

Defendant instructed to commit no new crimes.
Complete an mental health assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED AND STAYED -- at the use of the agent's discretion -- with Huber privileges for work and childcare.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin C Laboy

defendant.name: Laboy, Justin C
defendant.address: 5320 West Greenfield Avenue #204, West Milwaukee, WI 53214

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin C Laboy in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve FOUR MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 0 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work and childcare.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on JULY 25TH, 2022.  
Serve 30 DAYS of condition time in the House of Correction IMPOSED AND STAYED  -- at the use of the agent's discretion --  with Huber privileges for work and childcare. 
No possession or use of firearms.
Defendant instructed to commit no new crimes.
Complete an mental health assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
Complete 40 hours community service.
Pay fine in the amount of $300.00 inclusive of ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on JULY 25TH, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 
APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Justin C Laboy in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justin C Laboy appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 30. Plea/sentencing hearing is scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 1:30pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with W.Q.B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Justin C Laboy in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:03 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 038452,
Payable Number: 1001218,
Receipt Number: 22RP016178,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/26/2022 @01:30pm
